body:
**Is this a BUG REPORT or FEATURE REQUEST?**:
/kind bug

**What happened**:
In kubectl v1.10.0 none of `kubectl get all`, `kubectl get po,svc` and `kubectl get pods --show-kind` show the kind of the resource type of the objects:

```
▶ kubectl version --client --short
Client Version: v1.10.0

▶ kubectl get all
NAME                                   READY     STATUS    RESTARTS   AGE
kubernetes-bootcamp-7689dc585d-52m4q   1/1       Running   0          20h
kubernetes-bootcamp-7689dc585d-f6fsz   1/1       Running   0          20h

NAME                  TYPE        CLUSTER-IP    EXTERNAL-IP   PORT(S)          AGE
kubernetes            ClusterIP   10.96.0.1     <none>        443/TCP          22h
kubernetes-bootcamp   NodePort    10.96.40.16   <none>        8080:31923/TCP   21h
...

▶ kubectl get po,svc
NAME                                   READY     STATUS    RESTARTS   AGE
kubernetes-bootcamp-7689dc585d-52m4q   1/1       Running   0          20h
kubernetes-bootcamp-7689dc585d-f6fsz   1/1       Running   0          20h

NAME                  TYPE        CLUSTER-IP    EXTERNAL-IP   PORT(S)          AGE
kubernetes            ClusterIP   10.96.0.1     <none>        443/TCP          22h
kubernetes-bootcamp   NodePort    10.96.40.16   <none>        8080:31923/TCP   21h

▶ kubectl get pods --show-kind
NAME                                   READY     STATUS    RESTARTS   AGE
kubernetes-bootcamp-7689dc585d-52m4q   1/1       Running   0          20h
kubernetes-bootcamp-7689dc585d-f6fsz   1/1       Running   0          20h
```

**What you expected to happen**:
The same behavior as in kubectl v1.9.6, that the resource type is added to the name:
```
▶ ~/kubectl-test/kubectl-1.9.6 version --client --short
Client Version: v1.9.6

▶ ~/kubectl-test/kubectl-1.9.6 get all
NAME                                      READY     STATUS    RESTARTS   AGE
po/kubernetes-bootcamp-7689dc585d-52m4q   1/1       Running   0          20h
po/kubernetes-bootcamp-7689dc585d-f6fsz   1/1       Running   0          20h

NAME                      TYPE        CLUSTER-IP    EXTERNAL-IP   PORT(S)          AGE
svc/kubernetes            ClusterIP   10.96.0.1     <none>        443/TCP          22h
svc/kubernetes-bootcamp   NodePort    10.96.40.16   <none>        8080:31923/TCP   21h
...

▶ ~/kubectl-test/kubectl-1.9.6 get po,svc
NAME                                      READY     STATUS    RESTARTS   AGE
po/kubernetes-bootcamp-7689dc585d-52m4q   1/1       Running   0          20h
po/kubernetes-bootcamp-7689dc585d-f6fsz   1/1       Running   0          20h

NAME                      TYPE        CLUSTER-IP    EXTERNAL-IP   PORT(S)          AGE
svc/kubernetes            ClusterIP   10.96.0.1     <none>        443/TCP          22h
svc/kubernetes-bootcamp   NodePort    10.96.40.16   <none>        8080:31923/TCP   21h

▶ ~/kubectl-test/kubectl-1.9.6 get pods --show-kind
NAME                                      READY     STATUS    RESTARTS   AGE
po/kubernetes-bootcamp-7689dc585d-52m4q   1/1       Running   0          20h
po/kubernetes-bootcamp-7689dc585d-f6fsz   1/1       Running   0          20h
```

**How to reproduce it (as minimally and precisely as possible)**:
`kubectl get all` with kubectl v1.10.0

**Anything else we need to know?**:
The regression is also on the `master` branch when I built kubernetes myself.

labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a bug.
labels.name: kind/bug

labels.description: Must be staffed and worked on either currently, or very soon, ideally in time for the next release.
labels.name: priority/important-soon

labels.description: Categorizes an issue or PR as relevant to SIG CLI.
labels.name: sig/cli

title: "kubectl get all" or "kubectl get x --show-type" do not show the resource type in kubectl v1.10.0
